description: 20 synthetic documents for rare disease clinical trial feasibility evaluation covering patient funnel, local guidelines, investigator presence, and patient populations across 20 countries

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 65 years
Confirmed Fabry disease by alpha-galactosidase A enzyme assay or documented pathogenic GLA gene variant
eGFR >= 40 mL/min/1.73m2 by CKD-EPI equation
UPCR < 1.0 g/g
Stable dose of ACEi or ARB for at least 90 days prior to screening
If currently on ERT, stable dose for at least 12 months

eligibility_exclusion.text: History of severe anaphylactic reaction to ERT
Uncontrolled hypertension (systolic BP > 160 mmHg or diastolic > 100 mmHg)
Participation in another interventional trial within 30 days
Clinically significant cardiac arrhythmia requiring antiarrhythmic therapy

visit_schedule.frequency: every 2 weeks for infusion, every 3 months for assessment

endpoints.name: Annualized rate of change in eGFR
Change in left ventricular mass index by cardiac MRI

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: Board-certified nephrologist or metabolic disease specialist with >= 3 years Fabry disease experience

local_guidelines.guideline_name: German Society for Nephrology Fabry Disease Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: ERT initiation recommended when eGFR < 90 or proteinuria > 300 mg/day
Genetic confirmation mandatory before ERT start
Monitoring every 6 months with cardiac MRI annually
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Guideline-mandated genetic testing aligns with trial eligibility; existing monitoring infrastructure supports trial visit schedule

patient_population.geographic_distribution: Concentrated in university hospitals in Berlin, Munich, Hamburg, Cologne

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: Enzyme replacement therapy (ERT) with agalsidase beta or alfa

treatment_lines.therapy: ERT (agalsidase beta 1 mg/kg IV every 2 weeks)
Oral chaperone therapy (migalastat) for amenable mutations

invasive_procedures.name: lumbar puncture
invasive_procedures.note: trials requiring lumbar puncture report 20-25% dropout

visit_schedule.frequency: UHDRS-TMS every 6 months, cognitive assessment annually

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: at least 3 completed HD trials as PI or sub-investigator

local_guidelines.guideline_name: British Neurological Association and Huntington's Disease Association UK Clinical Practice Guidelines 2024
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Established specialist centre network with 16 sites and > 50 patient panel per site supports trial infrastructure

diagnostic_tests_required: genetic testing for HTT CAG repeat expansion

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: Symptomatic management (tetrabenazine for chorea, SSRIs for depression)

participation_barriers: progressive cognitive decline limits consent capacity

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 75 years
PAH confirmed by right heart catheterization: mPAP >= 25 mmHg, PCWP <= 15 mmHg, PVR > 3 Wood units
WHO functional class II or III
6MWD >= 150 meters and <= 500 meters
Treatment-naive (no prior PAH-specific therapy)
No significant left heart disease (LVEF > 50%)

eligibility_exclusion.text: PAH associated with portal hypertension, HIV infection, or congenital heart disease with Eisenmenger physiology
Systolic blood pressure < 90 mmHg at screening
Planned or listed for lung transplantation

screen_fail_reasons.reason: Hemodynamic criteria not met at right heart catheterization
WHO functional class I or IV

endpoints.name: Change in PVR by right heart catheterization
Adverse events, liver function tests, systemic blood pressure

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: pulmonary hypertension board certification, catheterization laboratory access, patient panel >= 20 active PAH patients

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Société de Pneumologie de Langue Française guidelines 2022
key_recommendations: Upfront dual or triple combination therapy for intermediate/high risk
Right heart catheterization mandatory for diagnosis
RHC at 3-6 month intervals for treatment response
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: National PAH network of 26 expert centres coordinated by Hôpital Bicêtre enables efficient recruitment

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: Endothelin receptor antagonists + PDE5 inhibitors (dual combination)

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Japan Society of Hepatology Wilson Disease Guidelines 2024
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Wilson disease designated as Nanbyo No. 171, providing subsidy program access; 23 expert centres with established monitoring infrastructure

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: Chelation therapy with D-penicillamine or trientine

participation_barriers: rare disease with limited patient pool

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 12 to 75 years
Documented diagnosis of HAE type I or II: low C4, C1-INH functional activity below 50%
At least 3 investigator-confirmed HAE attacks per month during 3-month run-in
Stable prophylactic therapy or no prophylactic therapy for at least 3 months
Access to and ability to use acute rescue medication

eligibility_exclusion.text: HAE with normal C1-INH (formerly HAE type III)
Current use of long-term systemic corticosteroids > 10 mg prednisone daily
Use of attenuated androgens within 3 months
Severe hepatic impairment (ALT or AST > 3x ULN)
History of thrombotic events within 12 months

screen_fail_reasons.reason: Fewer than 3 attacks per month during run-in
C1-INH functional activity within normal range

endpoints.name: Monthly rate of investigator-confirmed HAE attacks
Injection site reactions, liver function, coagulation, platelets

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: at least 15 active HAE patients and allergist/immunologist with HAE trial experience

local_guidelines.guideline_name: AAAAI/WAO HAE Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: Long-term prophylaxis for >= 2 attacks per month
Approved agents: SC C1-INH, lanadelumab, berotralstat
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Large registry (4,800 patients) with 180 clinical sites provides extensive characterized patient pool

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: Long-term prophylaxis with C1-INH replacement or lanadelumab

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Brazilian Society of Medical Genetics and Genomics Gaucher Disease Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: Imiglucerase 60 U/kg IV every 2 weeks (first-line ERT)
Treatment via SUS high-cost medication program
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: SUS coverage enables treatment access; 32 reference centres but regional disparity (58% in Southeast); supply chain disruptions in 40% of pharmacies

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: ERT with imiglucerase or velaglucerase alfa

participation_barriers: limited access to ERT in rural areas
diagnostic delay due to low disease awareness

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 55 years
Confirmed CF with sweat chloride >= 60 mmol/L
Homozygous for F508del-CFTR mutation
ppFEV1 >= 40% and <= 90% at screening
Stable pulmonary status for at least 28 days
Willing to undergo washout of current CFTR modulator for 28 days

eligibility_exclusion.text: Sputum culture positive for Burkholderia cepacia complex within 24 months
ALT or AST > 3x ULN or total bilirubin > 2x ULN
Use of strong CYP3A inducers or inhibitors within 14 days
Pulmonary exacerbation requiring IV antibiotics within 28 days

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: accredited CF care centre with pulmonologist having >= 2 years CF trial experience, patient panel >= 30

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Cystic Fibrosis Canada Clinical Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: ETI for all patients >= 2 years with at least one F508del allele
82% of eligible patients on CFTR modulator therapy
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: 98% of CF patients captured in Canadian CF Registry; 42 accredited clinics nationwide

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 80 years
Confirmed gMG (MGFA class II, III, or IV)
Positive anti-AChR antibody (titer > 0.5 nmol/L)
MG-ADL score >= 6, with at least 50% from non-ocular items
Stable MG treatment for at least 30 days
Meningococcal vaccination at least 14 days before first dose

eligibility_exclusion.text: MGFA class I (ocular only) or class V (intubated)
Plasma exchange or IVIg within 4 weeks

vaccination_requirements.vaccine_type: meningococcal tetravalent conjugate and serogroup B
vaccination_requirements.timing: at least 14 days before first dose

endpoints.name: Meningococcal monitoring, injection site reactions, liver function

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: board-certified neurologist with neuromuscular experience, QMG scoring proficiency

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Korean Neurological Association MG Treatment Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: Corticosteroids and steroid-sparing agents for inadequate response
Meningococcal vaccination mandatory before complement inhibitors
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Korean MG Registry (6,500 patients) enables efficient pre-screening; 38 neuromuscular centres; diagnostic delay 2.1 years (below global average)

local_guidelines.guideline_name: AISF/SIGE PBC Clinical Practice Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: UDCA 13-15 mg/kg/day first-line for all patients
Paris II or Barcelona response criteria at 12 months
Seladelpar and elafibranor for OCA-intolerant patients
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: 48 hepatology centres in registry, Italy top-3 enrolling country in global PBC phase 3 trials; large UDCA non-responder pool

eligibility_inclusion.text: Males aged 6 to 12 years
Genetically confirmed DMD amenable to exon 45 skipping
Ambulatory: >= 300 meters on 6MWT
Stable corticosteroid regimen for at least 6 months, no dose change > 20%
NSAA score >= 15

eligibility_exclusion.text: Non-ambulatory or wheelchair for community mobility
Current use of other investigational treatment

screen_fail_reasons.reason: Mutation not amenable to exon 45 skipping on central genetic confirmation
Corticosteroid dose not stable for 6 months

visit_schedule.frequency: weekly IV infusions (52) plus 7 assessment visits

endpoints.name: Change in dystrophin protein by Western blot on muscle biopsy
Renal function, platelet counts, complement markers

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: pediatric neurologist with >= 2 years DMD trial experience, certified 6MWT/NSAA physiotherapy team, pediatric anesthesia for biopsy

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Muscular Dystrophy Australia Clinical Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: Bone health DXA annually on steroids
Access to exon-skipping via TGA Special Access Scheme

patient_population.registry_name: TREAT-NMD / Australian National Neuromuscular Disease Registry

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Federal Ministry of Health Nigeria SCD Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: Chronic exchange transfusion for stroke prevention
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Massive patient pool but < 500,000 under active follow-up; infrastructure challenges: unreliable electricity (65% of centres), limited internet (60%), extended regulatory timeline (6-8 months NAFDAC)

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age >= 18 years
Centrally confirmed AdvSM (ASM, SM-AHN, or MCL) per WHO 2022
KIT D816V mutation confirmed by central digital PCR (allele burden >= 0.1%)
At least 1 evaluable C-finding
ECOG PS 0, 1, or 2
Platelet count >= 50,000/mm3
Adequate hepatic function: bilirubin <= 1.5x ULN, ALT/AST <= 3x ULN

eligibility_exclusion.text: Indolent SM or smoldering SM without C-findings
Active bleeding or intracranial hemorrhage within 6 months

screen_fail_reasons.reason: KIT D816V not confirmed by central digital PCR
SM subtype reclassified to indolent SM

endpoints.name: Overall response rate by IWG-MRT-ECNM criteria
Change in KIT D816V allele burden
Intracranial hemorrhage, cognitive effects, edema, cytopenias

local_guidelines.guideline_name: SEHH (Spanish Society of Hematology) AdvSM Guidelines
key_recommendations: Bone marrow biopsy at diagnosis and every 6 months
KIT D816V digital PCR for diagnosis and monitoring
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: REMA network (world's largest, 5,200 patients, 14 centres) provides decisive advantage; centralized reference laboratory in Toledo

participation_barriers: rare disease with very limited patient pool

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Dutch Society for Inborn Errors of Metabolism / MetabERN NPC Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: Miglustat 200 mg TID for neurological NPC
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: 6 metabolic centres ensuring < 150 km travel for any patient; Amsterdam UMC as national coordinating centre; international pooling essential due to ultra-rare nature

patient_population.registry_name: Dutch NPC Registry (Amsterdam UMC) / European NPC Registry (INPDA)

participation_barriers: ultra-rare disease with extremely limited patient pool

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 65 years
Biopsy-proven IgAN within 24 months
UPCR >= 1.0 g/g on two separate measurements despite maximally tolerated RAS inhibitor
eGFR >= 30 mL/min/1.73m2
Less than 50% glomeruli showing global sclerosis

eligibility_exclusion.text: Secondary IgAN (IgA vasculitis, lupus nephritis, liver cirrhosis)
Systemic corticosteroids or immunosuppressants within 3 months

screen_fail_reasons.reason: UPCR below 1.0 g/g on repeat testing
Biopsy not within 24 months or >= 50% glomerulosclerosis

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: nephrologist with >= 3 years glomerulonephritis experience, renal biopsy capability, patient panel >= 50 IgAN

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Chinese Society of Nephrology IgAN Guidelines 2023
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: World's largest IgAN registry (180,000 patients, 320 centres); China contributed >50% enrollment; IgAN accounts for 40-45% of all renal biopsies in China

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: ACE inhibitor/ARB + corticosteroids for proteinuria > 1 g/day

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Argentine Society of Dermatology EB Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: Nutritional support 150% caloric intake for RDEB
SCC surveillance starting age 15 for RDEB
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: 12 RAEB centres but 42% patients in Buenos Aires; 6.2 year diagnostic delay; IFM only at 3 centres; DEBRA transport subsidies for 4 trips/year

treatment_lines.therapy: Gene therapy (investigational) or bone marrow transplant

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 55 years
Confirmed PKU: documented PAH gene mutations or newborn screening diagnosis with historical Phe > 1000 micromol/L
Blood Phe >= 600 micromol/L at screening (mean of 2 measurements)
Willing to maintain current dietary regimen
Effective contraception for women of childbearing potential

eligibility_exclusion.text: Current pregnancy or breastfeeding or planned pregnancy
History of anaphylaxis to PEGylated therapies
Unable to self-inject or commit to daily injection

screen_fail_reasons.reason: History of anaphylaxis to PEGylated therapies
Inability to self-inject or commit to schedule

endpoints.name: Injection site reactions, anaphylaxis, arthralgia, anti-drug antibodies, liver function

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Turkish Ministry of Health National PKU Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: Sapropterin trial for all newly diagnosed
Monthly blood Phe monitoring (children), every 3 months (adults)
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: One of highest PKU prevalence globally (1:4,200) due to consanguinity; national NBS since 1993 with >99% coverage; 42 metabolic centres; 12,500 patients in registry

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Indian Academy of Medical Genetics Pompe Disease Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: Alglucosidase alfa 20 mg/kg IV every 2 weeks
ERT as early as possible for IOPD
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Only 3.4% diagnostic rate; ERT access through Sanofi humanitarian program (180 patients); pilot NBS in 3 states covering 15% of births; CDSCO approval 3-6 months; mandatory post-trial access provisions

participation_barriers: ERT access limitations in rural India
diagnostic delay due to low awareness

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 75 years
PNH confirmed by flow cytometry: GPI-deficient granulocyte clone >= 10%
Hemoglobin < 10 g/dL at screening
Stable eculizumab for >= 6 months
LDH < 1.5x ULN
Reticulocyte count > ULN
Meningococcal vaccination current

eligibility_exclusion.text: Active or recent Neisseria meningitidis infection
Active thrombosis or anticoagulation change within 3 months
Bone marrow failure requiring >= 4 RBC transfusions in 12 weeks
Prior complement inhibitor other than eculizumab

vaccination_requirements.timing: current per local guidelines, booster every 3 years

visit_schedule.frequency: eculizumab infusions every 2 weeks plus assessment visits

endpoints.name: Breakthrough hemolysis, Neisseria surveillance, hepatic function

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: hematologist with >= 2 years PNH experience, eculizumab infusion capability, high-sensitivity flow cytometry access

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Swedish Society of Hematology PNH Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: Complement inhibitor for symptomatic intravascular hemolysis
Blood monitoring every 4 weeks on eculizumab
High-sensitivity flow cytometry at diagnosis and annually
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: Centralized care in 7 university hospitals; Swedish PNH Registry (98 patients); Nordic countries collectively contributed 29.3% enrollment

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Mexican Academy of Neurology TSC Guidelines 2024
key_recommendations: Everolimus for SEGA >= 1 cm, AML >= 3 cm, refractory epilepsy
Brain MRI every 1-3 years until age 25
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: 22 centres in registry but 32% patients in Mexico City; everolimus supply interruptions in 35% of centres; genetic testing at INMEGEN (6-12 weeks); COFEPRIS approval 4-6 months

patient_population.registry_name: Mexican TSC Registry (Registro Mexicano de Esclerosis Tuberosa)

treatment_pathway.current_standard_of_care: mTOR inhibitor (everolimus) for SEGA and renal angiomyolipomas

eligibility_inclusion.text: Age 18 to 80 years
Documented pathogenic TTR variant confirmed by central lab
Amyloid deposition confirmed by tissue biopsy or Tc-99m pyrophosphate scintigraphy (Perugini >= 2)
PND score I, II, IIIa, or IIIb (FAP stage 1 or 2)
NIS >= 5 and <= 130
If on tafamidis, stable dose >= 6 months

eligibility_exclusion.text: PND score IV (wheelchair-bound or bedridden, FAP stage 3)
Current or prior gene silencing therapy within 6 months
LVEF < 40%, NT-proBNP > 3000 pg/mL, NYHA class IV

epidemiology.value: 1 in 538 in endemic regions (Póvoa de Varzim/Vila do Conde)

screen_fail_reasons.reason: TTR variant classified as VUS on central review

sites_and_investigators.investigator_requirements: neurologist with neuromuscular experience, certified NCS capability, echocardiography with strain imaging, patient panel >= 10 ATTRv

local_guidelines.guideline_name: Sociedade Portuguesa de Neurologia ATTRv Guidelines 2023
key_recommendations: Genetic testing for all first-degree relatives starting age 18
Annual neurological, cardiac, and ophthalmologic monitoring for carriers
Treatment at symptom onset: tafamidis, patisiran, inotersen, vutrisiran
Liver transplant largely superseded by pharmacotherapy since 2012
local_guidelines.impact_on_feasibility: World's oldest ATTRv registry (since 1939, 5,400 individuals); Unidade Corino de Andrade global reference centre; 80+ years clinical experience; highest global prevalence in endemic regions

patient_population.registry_name: Portuguese Familial Amyloidosis Registry (Unidade Corino de Andrade)

diagnostic_tests_required: tissue biopsy with Congo red staining

treatment_lines.therapy: Patisiran IV every 3 weeks or inotersen SC weekly
